channel.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
channel.description:
Okay so on my website I have set up a SQL to my IP which would be crimsonscape1.no-ip.org I have then edited launcher to allow this
This is how my database is setup on the website and in my "Launcher" (Hidden some stuff just for safety) what am I doing wrong here? I get a connection to SQL problem.
[code] public static MainLoader vote = new MainLoader("crimsonscape1.no-ip.org", "crimsons_******", "*****", "crimsons_********"); [/code]

item.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Read gtlvote’s thread

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
item.dc:creator: @MikeMike1997 MikeMike1997
item.description:
@MikeMike1997 wrote:

Ahh okay. Well I added RuneLocus and another one but they don’t callback that I’ve voted. Do I need to add anything to the script? and can I add Moparscape? (I know it won’t registering them voting but will it let them continue even if they don’t vote on Mopar?)

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Coldmedicine:

Some toplists dont have callback.

Specifically, Moparscape. There’s no callback… yet.

item.dc:creator: @MikeMike1997 MikeMike1997
item.description:
@MikeMike1997 wrote:

Thanks for all your help guys, I had got the database & username round the wrong way and forgot to add my RemoteSQL after they reset my host! Life savers!

BUT- One question is can I callback function for things like Moparscape? I set up Runelocus but not sure how to do Moparscape?

item.source: Auto Vote not connecting to Website

item.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
item.dc:creator: @MikeMike1997 MikeMike1997
item.description:
@MikeMike1997 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:549113”][quote author=MikeMike1997 link=topic=668022.msg4468065#msg4468065 date=1421276354]

x3 better change the password of the database just in case…
I don’t know how long you had em posted but if I saw it and was able to post, it was more than enough time to get your data.

About 1 minute haha!

Whats weird is I can connect on my computer but I put it on my server and it won’t connect to the database?

I don’t exactly get what you’re saying… If you server as in vps:
Did you make sure to put your VPS’s IP in the remote SQL list?

It’s my own server, home address server. But the IP is already on it? I’m really confused why it’s not working. It’s the same script?
[/quote]
OHHH okay. I forgot some people might actually have a literal server in their house. I’m used to people using a vps.

Have you done everything the same on the server as the your pc? Like firewall and porting wise. I would assume so but I’m just checking.[/quote]

I know get this error?

[GTLVote V1.1] Settings initializing...
[GTLVote V1.1] Error connecting to the database.
java.sql.SQLException: Access denied for user 'databasename(hidden for obvious reason)'@'host-*********.as13285.net' (using password: YES)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:946)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:2941)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:868)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.secureAuth411(MysqlIO.java:3340)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.doHandshake(MysqlIO.java:1238)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.createNewIO(Connection.java:2743)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.<init>(Connection.java:1553)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.NonRegisteringDriver.connect(NonRegisteringDriver.java
:266)
        at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source)
        at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(Unknown Source)
        at org.Vote.Connect.connect(Connect.java:18)
        at org.Vote.MainLoader.<init>(MainLoader.java:22)
        at com.rs.Launcher.<clinit>(Launcher.java:49)

Read full topic

item.source: Auto Vote not connecting to Website

item.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
item.dc:creator: @MikeMike1997 MikeMike1997
item.description:
@MikeMike1997 wrote:

By this do you mean www.crimsonscape.x10.mx/forum - www.crimsonscape.x10.mx or the webhosting place www.x10hosting.com?

Thanks

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549113”]“The driver has not received any packets from the server.”

and
"Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect"

Tells me:
1: You don’t have the login info correct (Website, database, user, pass)
2: You do not have your IP in the Remote IP list
3: There’s a firewall blocking you.

Start with #1
Your fields in the MainLoader should be in the exact order I said: (Website, database, user, pass)
if “http://crimsonscape1.no-ip.org/” is the No-IP you are using for your computer (to host the server), that is the wrong information. It needs to be your website, A.k.a http://google.com

We can move to #2 once you’ve verified the data is right.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Auto Vote not connecting to Website

item.title: Auto Vote not connecting to Website
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

“The driver has not received any packets from the server.”

and
"Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect"

Tells me:
1: You don’t have the login info correct (Website, database, user, pass)
2: You do not have your IP in the Remote IP list
3: There’s a firewall blocking you.

Start with #1
Your fields in the MainLoader should be in the exact order I said: (Website, database, user, pass)
if “http://crimsonscape1.no-ip.org/” is the No-IP you are using for your computer (to host the server), that is the wrong information. It needs to be your website, A.k.a http://google.com

We can move to #2 once you’ve verified the data is right.

Read full topic
